intro: Schefflera lucescens var. grandifolia, commonly known as the giant umbrella plant, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, umbrella-like compound leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in diameter. The plant has a dense, bushy growth habit and produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers followed by dark blue berries. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil and indirect sunlight. Its striking foliage makes it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor ornamental gardening.
